article_title: Fear Grows in Greece as Decisive Hour Nears
article_text:
Greece requested a new three-year bailout from its skeptical eurozone creditors and pledged some economic overhauls on Wednesday, but the euphoria some Greeks felt after Sunday’s “no” vote on the last deal was fading fast.

Whether European leaders accept the Greek government’s application for more emergency loans at a crisis summit Sunday still depends on Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras making a drastic turnaround on pension cuts, tax...

twitter.description: As its creditors continue to express skepticism and capital controls bite into supplies of cash and even medicine, many Greeks are finding the euphoria after Sunday’s “no” vote fading fast.
twitter.creator: @MatinaStevis

image.alt: Fear grows in Greece as decisive hour nears

twitter.title: Fear Grows in Greece as Decisive Hour Nears
